ygData.subject: Re: Veratis
ygData.msgSnippet: Veratis wanted to keep her inside until she sniffed him. He knew that newly formed protoforms tended to have a feral aspect about them. It was to his advantage

Veratis wanted to keep her inside until she sniffed him. He knew that 
newly formed protoforms tended to have a feral aspect about them. It 
was to his advantage to let her out and see what she was capable 
of. "Alright, you can go out but stay close I don't want you having 
any problems with your new form." he led her to the door and let her 
out. It was later in the day than he was used to. He needed some 
rest. he couldn't rest though, not with Shadow Wing still adjusting. 
He had to be awake in case anything happened to her.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Shadow Wing::
> 
> She looked at Veratis.  She was taller than him. She looked at 
> herself and wondered how this could have happened.  She tested her 
> wings and started to lift herself off the floor. She stopped and 
set 
> back down. She looked at Veratis. "Can we go and test it out now. I 
> want to know all I can about this form. This is something that I 
have 
> never experienced before."  Then she felt something else move 
inside, 
> but it wasn't wires. She was hungry. "And I need to hunt, soon, 
very 
> soon." She  moved her head closer to Veratis and sniffed his 
scent.  
> He smelled different, alive. Her scence of smell was highly 
developed 
> and so was her hearing. 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > Veratis stepped forward placing a hand on her fur. He heard her 
> speak 
> > so he knew her transformation was successfull. She stood taller 
> than 
> > him in her bear mode. he placed his hands on her wings, by all 
> logic 
> > they shouldn't have existed. somehow her memories triggered this 
> > change. He scanned her entire body, it was healthy whatever she 
was.
> > 
> > "I don't know what you did to change the dna sequencing but 
somehow 
> > your owl form showed up." His mind was filled with a thousand 
> > questions but he couldn't bring himself to ask them all. "Just 
rest 
> > for now and when you're 100 percent we'll go outside and try out 
> your 
> > new form."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > > Shadow Wing::
> > > She looked down and sighed heavily.  She missed him a lot and 
> > wished 
> > > to see him again. Then again, he may not recongnize her in her 
> new 
> > > form. She wondered if he would still be happy to see her in her 
> new 
> > > form. She looked at Veratis. "Yes, I understand. What am I 
> supposed 
> > > to do now? I'm not fully complete yet.  This form is still 
> > changing. 
> > > and I don't know..." she stopped and doubled over as she 
clutched 
> > at 
> > > her stomach.  Her internal circuits were in the last stages of 
> > > generation.  She held onto the table for suport. She fell to 
her 
> > > knees nd transformed into beast mode. The form was in finally 
> > stages 
> > > of completetion.  Normall a bot is asleep through this and 
> doesn't 
> > > experience pain, but she was wide awake and going through the 
> > ordeal. 
> > > She transformed into polar bear with the owl wings protruding 
> from 
> > > her shoulder blades. Her hands transformed into massive paws 
with 
> > > huge claws.  Her white fur now covered her completely and her 
> eyes 
> > > were a pearcing bright blue. Her sence of smell and hearing was 
> > > greatly increased and she roared out a bear roar as she 
finished 
> > her 
> > > change.  She stood in beast mode and looked at Vertis. Her 
wings 
> > > extended over her and her bear head up. She said in a shocked 
> > > voice, "By the matrix...." 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > "You can't reach him because your link was broken when I 
> removed 
> > > your spark
> > > > from his old body." he figured that was a logical assumption 
to 
> > > tell her.
> > > > "Now you will just have to stop worrying about him for a 
while 
> > and 
> > > start
> > > > thinking about yourself. You have a very unexpected form and 
> will 
> > > need time
> > > > to adjust. Lunarpine is a bigbot that can take care of 
himself."
> > > > 
> > > > Veratis studied the readings he'd been taking the whole time 
> she 
> > was
> > > > forming. He set down the results he'd found, turned to her 
> looked 
> > > her
> > > > directly in the eyes. "Lunarpine promised he'd return for 
you. 
> I 
> > > think he'd
> > > > crawl on his belly if he had to. Any bot who'd risk his own 
> > > existence to
> > > > carry two sparks isn't one to give up easily. He'll be back."
